title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 20 May 2008 - XWiki
content:
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 08:36): XWiki.LD was modified by XWiki.LD (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/LD  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:00): Hello here  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:01): This morning I will branch XWiki Workspaces 1.1, to have it built on XW 1.3 branch  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:01): hi jvelociter\_   
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:01): I'm sending a mail on devs list to tell that too  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:01): so trunk is what, 2.0?  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:01): (I meant XE 1.3à  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:02): xws trunk is what version?  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:02): no, I would like a branch separate from the release iteration  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:02): so the branch is for what, 1.1.1?  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:02): trunk stays 1.1-SNAPSHOT  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:02): so branch is 1.0.1?  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:02): for example  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:02): I already have a branch 1.0-SNAPSHOT  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:03): this not possible  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:03): hum  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:03): oh you mean  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:03): wait  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:03): so if you alreayd have it then why do you need to create a new branch?  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:03): then I can backport whole I need for 1.0.1, but I don't like it either  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:03): s/whole/all  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:03): I don't get it  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:03): :)  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:03): ok, let me explain more clearly  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:03): :)  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:05): I need a version of workspaces with features from 1.1 (trunk) (like the "open" access level), but built on XWiki 1.3 (trunk is built on 1.4)  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:05): So I can do that in my 1.0 branch, but that would mean introducing new features on that branch  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:07): why do you want trunk to be using XE 1.4 then?  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:07): why not have it use XE 1.3 instead if that's what you want?  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:08): well, this is not mandatory per se  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:08): or said differently  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:08): why do you need to build XWS with XE 1.3?  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:08): it's just nicer to use latest version of our products  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:08): (it is so I reversed my question)  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:08): I know, that was the one I expected first :))  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:08): :)  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:09): I need that for a client project, for XPertNet  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:09): ahah so that's completely different  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:09): we're not talking about a public release  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:09): no, we're not  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:09): indeed  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:09): the right way to do this   
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:10): is to create a client branch in a different svn repo (in order not to mix it with the public open sourc erepo)  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:10): fine with me  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:10): xipe: what do you think ?  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:11): another solution fro you is to upgrade the client to use XE 1.4  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:11): (this is a better solution IMO)  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:11): (since he will need to upgrade to 1.4 anyway)  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:12): you just have to say that XWS only works with XE 1.4 and above ,)  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:12): ;)  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:12): just kidding here, I don't know the context so that's up to you really  
xipe - (20/05/2008 11:13): ok for me (different repo)  
jvelociter\_ - (20/05/2008 11:14): vmassol: xipe , thanks, we will do it like this  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:34): DevGuide.BestPractices was modified by xwiki:XWiki.LudovicDubost - http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/BestPractices

xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:47): XWiki.TagClass was modified by XWiki.Admin - http://laloutre.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/TagClass  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:47): XWiki.CalendarEvent was modified by XWiki.Admin - http://laloutre.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/CalendarEvent  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:47): XWiki.XWikiPreferences was modified by XWiki.Admin - http://laloutre.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiPreferences  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:47): XWiki.Import was modified by XWiki.superadmin - http://laloutre.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Import  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:47): Blog.Categories was modified by XWiki.Admin - http://laloutre.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/Categories  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:47): Panels.PanelClass was modified by XWiki.Admin - http://laloutre.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Panels/PanelClass  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:47): XWiki.ArticleClass was modified by XWiki.Admin - http://laloutre.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/ArticleClass  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:47): XWiki.PhotoAlbumClass was modified by XWiki.Admin - http://laloutre.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/PhotoAlbumClass  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:47): XWiki.PresentationClass was modified by XWiki.Admin - http://laloutre.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/PresentationClass  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:47): XWiki.SlideClass was modified by XWiki.Admin - http://laloutre.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/SlideClass  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:47): Blog.Category was modified by XWiki.Admin - http://laloutre.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/Category  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:47): Blog.CreateBlogPost was modified by XWiki.Admin - http://laloutre.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/CreateBlogPost  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:47): hmmm  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:47): Blog.Macros was modified by XWiki.Admin - http://laloutre.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/Macros  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:48): Blog.WebHome was modified by XWiki.Admin - http://laloutre.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:48): Blog.WikiLaunch was modified by XWiki.Admin - http://laloutre.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/WikiLaunch  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:48): who's creating a new wiki?  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:48): Main.AllDocs was modified by XWiki.Admin - http://laloutre.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/AllDocs  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:48): Main.BlogRss was modified by XWiki.Admin - http://laloutre.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/BlogRss  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:48): Main.Dashboard was modified by XWiki.Admin - http://laloutre.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Dashboard  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:48): Main.EventCalendar was modified by XWiki.Admin - http://laloutre.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/EventCalendar  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 11:48): Main.LuceneSearch was modified by XWiki.Admin - http://laloutre.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/LuceneSearch  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:48): we hsouldn't create new wikis on xwiki.org  
xipe - (20/05/2008 11:48): Why not ?  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:49): what is it about?  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:49): xwiki.org is about the xwiki community  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:49): myxwiki.org is the farm  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:49): not xwiki.org  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:49): what is laloutre?  
xipe - (20/05/2008 11:49): It's for hosting some page and have a svn access  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:49): if I'm a xwiki user what would I need to see it?  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 11:49): s/what/why  
xipe - (20/05/2008 11:51): I need this  wiki to be connected to the SVN  
xipe - (20/05/2008 11:51): And only the xwikiorg farm is connected to the svn  
xipe - (20/05/2008 11:51): so I create it on .org  
vmassol - (20/05/2008 12:12): for the record after talking to xipe it's temporary and will be moved somewhere else  
vmassol\_ - (20/05/2008 14:49): SourceKibitzer analysis of our SVN repo: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/EyeQReports  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 16:51): Macros.JiraMacro was modified by xwiki:XWiki.VincentMassol - http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/JiraMacro  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 17:01): AdminGuide.ImportExportSnippet was modified by xwiki:XWiki.jvdrean - http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/ImportExportSnippet  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 17:03): AdminGuide.ImportExport was modified by xwiki:XWiki.VincentMassol (Added comment) - http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/ImportExport  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 17:07): Macros.JiraMacro was modified by xwiki:XWiki.GuillaumeSauthier - http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/JiraMacro  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 17:07): Macros.JiraMacro was modified by xwiki:XWiki.GuillaumeSauthier - http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/JiraMacro  
daning - (20/05/2008 17:09): I submit a issue for xe 1.3.1 and 1.3.2. Now I find that this issue is also found in xe 1.4. Do I need to update the issue?  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 17:09): Macros.JiraMacro was modified by xwiki:XWiki.GuillaumeSauthier - http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/JiraMacro  
xwikibot - (20/05/2008 17:11): Macros.JiraMacro was modified by xwiki:XWiki.GuillaumeSauthier - http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/JiraMacro  
vmassol\_ - (20/05/2008 17:13): daning: no need, the affects means if affects since the version given  
daning - (20/05/2008 17:13): I'm looking the issues. I see many categories and statistics by versions. Which places should I firstly look when I see the issues home page?  
daning - (20/05/2008 17:15): What do issues assigned with no version mean? Do this issues affect every versions?  
vmassol\_ - (20/05/2008 17:21): affects is the version it affects  
vmassol\_ - (20/05/2008 17:21): if you say affects 1.2 it means 1.2 and onward  
vmassol\_ - (20/05/2008 17:22): all issues must have an affects field filled  
vmassol\_ - (20/05/2008 17:22): (daning)  
vmassol\_ - (20/05/2008 17:22): the fix for is the version in which it has been fixed  
daning - (20/05/2008 17:31): I find a closed issue but the fix is not work. How can I reopen this issue?  
thomasmortagne - (20/05/2008 17:45): daning: hi, which issue ?  
daning - (20/05/2008 17:46): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-168  
daning - (20/05/2008 17:46): a very little problem.  
thomasmortagne - (20/05/2008 17:46): and you found this problem in trunks ?  
thomasmortagne - (20/05/2008 17:48): is http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-2024 fail too ?  
daning - (20/05/2008 17:50): yes. It fails too.  
daning - (20/05/2008 17:51): the addition should like this <input type="hidden" name="parent" value="$!doc.parent" />  
thomasmortagne - (20/05/2008 17:51): I'm reopening theissue  
thomasmortagne - (20/05/2008 17:52): go for it :)  
daning - (20/05/2008 17:53): if use request.parent, when you edit a parent in inline mode, you will lose the page's parent value. Because the parent value of request is null.  
daning - (20/05/2008 17:53): I created this issue http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-226  
daning - (20/05/2008 17:53): and this three issues are duplicated. How to relate this three issues?  
thomasmortagne - (20/05/2008 17:54): you can use "Link" in the left menu  
daning - (20/05/2008 17:57): I add a link but I did select duplicated, how to edit link?  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 17:58): You can delete that link and add another one  
thomasmortagne - (20/05/2008 17:58): click on "Issue Links"  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 17:58): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/secure/ManageLinks.jspa?id=19133  
vmassol\_ - (20/05/2008 17:58): if there are duplicate they should closed as duplicates  
vmassol\_ - (20/05/2008 17:59): so that only one remains  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 17:59): The proper fix I think should be to wrap the input in an if  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 17:59): #if("$!request.parent" != "")  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 17:59): <input ....  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 17:59): #end  
vmassol\_ - (20/05/2008 17:59): reopening is a bit dangerous  
vmassol\_ - (20/05/2008 18:00): since it means JV didn't fix anything   
vmassol\_ - (20/05/2008 18:00): as it'll disappear from the release notes  
vmassol\_ - (20/05/2008 18:00): I'm pretty sure he fixed something  
vmassol\_ - (20/05/2008 18:00): but maybe it wasn't enough  
vmassol\_ - (20/05/2008 18:00): in which case it's better to create a new issue more specific about the remaining issues  
vmassol\_ - (20/05/2008 18:00): unless of course JV made a completely wrong fix  
vmassol\_ - (20/05/2008 18:00): ;)  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 18:03): I renamed XE-168 to better reflect what actually happened  
daning - (20/05/2008 18:04): yes. inline mode is better.  
daning - (20/05/2008 18:05): IMO, sdumitriu's wrap solution is good. But the code is already changed in xe 1.4, do we need fix it now?  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 18:06): It will be in 1.5, and maybe 1.4.1 if there will be one  
daning - (20/05/2008 18:15): In xe, every blog post have a title, and the doc contain this post have a $title too. Do you think this two title should synchronize?  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 18:17): They should, but it can only be done using an event listener  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 18:17): (done in a proper way)  
daning - (20/05/2008 18:21): Can't we just set the doc title as the blog title when user save the blog in inline mode?  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 18:24): Where should that set be?  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 18:24): Becaue I can't find a nice place to put it  
daning - (20/05/2008 18:28): I thought $doc.setTitle("title") should work, but I found this shouldn't affect unless add $doc.save() by admin to this page.  
daning - (20/05/2008 18:59): hi. How does xwiki export page to pdf? use pof?  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 18:59): Yes  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 18:59): fop  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 19:00): See http://xepecnet.environmentalchange.net/xwiki/bin/download/ICT/Export/XWikiExport200805192259.png  
vmassol\_ - (20/05/2008 19:01): hehe  
vmassol\_ - (20/05/2008 19:01): was going to paste the same ;)  
daning - (20/05/2008 19:02): xwiki can't handle chinese when export pdf because fop don't support chinese?  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 19:02): No, it's the font that can't handle chinese  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 19:02): We should bundle a complete font  
daning - (20/05/2008 19:03): system font can displayer chinese well. Can we use the system fonts?  
daning - (20/05/2008 19:03): Will a complete font  be too large for xwiki release?  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 19:04): No, we can't use system fonts directly  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 19:05): fop needs to do some custom processing  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 19:05): We could have some code to do that processing when the platform starts, but it would be very platform specific  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 19:06): And the system font usually is MS Arial, which we can absolutely not redistribute  
sdumitriu - (20/05/2008 19:06): I'm waiting for the final stixfonts release  
daning - (20/05/2008 19:11): have to go to sleep. see you tomorrow:)
